name: Buriki One
overview:
Buriki One: World Grapple Tournament '99 in Tokyo is a one-on-one fighting game with 3D graphics.

There are 12 fighters in total, including the end boss. There is only one background arena, the Tokyo Dome and there are ads integrated into the game environment. The billboards show real worlds brands and electronics products of the time.

A fighter can win by knocking out their opponent, forcing his opponent to surrender, or by winning a judgment by a panel of three judges if time runs out. The judges are allowed to cast ballots for either fighter or a tie ballot that does not contribute to the decision. A tie will force a player to either give up or buy a continue. The fighters can also fall out of the ring, the game then resets both fighters inside the ring and continues.
